title: TV tonight: ‘The Batch Lady’ prepares Christmas dinner three months early
summary: Suzanne Mulholland and Joe Swash assist a family in creating a simple and enjoyable festive meal. Additionally, Kate Winslet discusses her experience directing her first film. This highlights what to watch this evening.

title: Australia v England: Ashes second Test, day two – live
summary: In the second day of the match at the Gabba, the tourists were bowled out for 334 runs. England's Joe Root scored an impressive unbeaten century. Follow our writers for ongoing updates from the game.

title: Over a pint in Oxford, we may have stumbled upon the holy grail of agriculture | George Monbiot
summary: Guardian columnist George Monbiot describes a transformative realization about the potential of soil science, which inspired the creation of the Earth Rover Program. This initiative aims to enhance our understanding of soil and its significant impact on environmental issues. Monbiot believes that this revolution in soil knowledge could lead to substantial global change.

title: ‘Three sheets to the wind’: how everyday phrases blew in from the sea
summary: Recent windy weather in the UK has inspired various phrases and idioms in the English language, including "all at sea" and "by and large." These expressions reflect how environmental conditions can influence linguistic evolution. The report highlights the interplay between weather patterns and language development.
